all.description: Include all additional info for mass spectra.  Overrides other flags.

ionization_mode.description: Include whether the spectrum was collected in a positive or negative mode experiment.  Not always available.

num_peaks.description: Include the number of peaks in the spectrum.

rating.description: Include a clean/noisy rating for the spectrum, based on the spectral and normalized entropy scores.

spectral_entropy.description: Include the spectral entropy score for a given spectrum.  Will be missing for spectra with only one peak.

always_download_file.description: If false, a search that does not find any matching records in the database will just return a message instead of a file.

base_url.description: URL for the AMOS frontend.  Used to construct the internal links in the output file.

ids.description: List of DTXSIDs or other identifiers to search for.

include_classyfire.description: Flag for whether to include the top four levels of a ClassyFire classification for each of the searched substances, if it exists.

include_external_links.description: Flag for whether to include database records that are purely external links (e.g., spectra that we can link to but cannot store directly in the database).

include_functional_uses.description: Flag for whether to include functional use classifications based on the ChemFuncT ontology.  Only exists for around 21,000 substances in the database.

include_source_counts.description: Flag for whether to include counts of a substance's appearances in patents, PubMed articles, and other external sources.

methodologies.description: Filters the returned results by analytical methodologies.  This argument should be a dictionary with four keys with boolean values -- "all", "GC/MS", "LC/MS", and "NMR".  There are some methodologies with small numbers of records (e.g., IR spectra) which will only appear in the data if "all" is set to true.

record_types.description: Filters returned results by record type.  This argument should be a dictionary with three keys with boolean values -- "Fact Sheet", "Method", and "Spectrum".  Note that the "Spectrum" flag will return spectra of all types -- mass, NMR, etc.

kingdom.description: Kingdom-level (highest) classification of a substance.  Always required.

klass.description: Class-level (third-highest) classification of a substance.  Required if requesting a list of subclasses.

superklass.description: Superclass-level (second-highest) classification of a substance.  Required if requesting a list of classes or subclasses.

lower_mass_limit.description: Lower limit of the mass range to search for.

upper_mass_limit.description: Upper limit of the mass range to search for.

dtxsids.description: List of DTXSIDs to search for.

da_window.description: Mass window in units of daltons.  If not null, this will be used for similarity calculations, regardless of whether ppm_window is supplied.

dtxsids.description: List of DTXSIDs to search for.

min_intensity.description: Minimum intensity level for peaks in both the user and database spectra to consider.  All database spectra are scaled to have a maximum intensity of 100, and all user spectra are assumed to be scaled the same.

ms_level.description: Level of mass spectrometry; if supplied, then only spectra at the specified level will be returned.  Valid values are from 1 to 5.

ppm_window.description: Mass window in units of parts per million.  Will only be used if da_window is null or not passed and ppm_window is not null.

spectra.description: A list of spectra, where each spectrum is an array of m/z-intensity pairs formatted as two-element arrays.  Maximum intensity should be scaled to 100.

base_url.description: URL for the AMOS frontend.  Used to construct the internal links in the output file.

ids.description: List of DTXSIDs or other identifiers to search for.

include_classyfire.description: Flag for whether to include the top four levels of a ClassyFire classification for each of the searched substances, if it exists.

include_functional_uses.description: Flag for whether to include functional use classifications based on the ChemFuncT ontology.  Only exists for around 21,000 substances in the database.

include_source_counts.description: Flag for whether to include counts of a substance's appearances in patents, PubMed articles, and other external sources.

methodologies.description: Filters the returned results by analytical methodologies.  This argument should be a dictionary with four keys with boolean values -- "all", "GC/MS", "LC/MS", and "NMR".  There are some methodologies with small numbers of records (e.g., IR spectra) which will only appear in the data if "all" is set to true.

spectrum_1.description: Array of m/z intensity pairs.  Should be formatted as an array of two-element arrays, each of which has the m/z value and the intensity value (in that order).  Peaks should be sorted in increasing order of m/z values.

spectrum_2.description: Array of m/z intensity pairs.  Should be formatted as an array of two-element arrays, each of which has the m/z value and the intensity value (in that order).  Peaks should be sorted in increasing order of m/z values.

type.description: Type of mass window to use.  Should be either "da" or "ppm".

window.description: Size of the mass window to use.  Will be in units of the 'type' argument.

dtxsids.description: List of DTXSIDs to search for.

lower_mass_limit.description: Lower limit of the mass range to search for.

methodology.description: Analytical methodology to search for.  Values aside from "GC/MS" and "LC/MS" are highly unlikely to produce results.

spectrum.description: Array of two-element numeric arrays.  The two-element arrays represent a single peak in the spectrum, in the format [m/z, intensity].  Peaks should be sorted in ascending order of m/z values.

type.description: Type of mass window to use for entropy similarity calculations.  Can be either "da" or "ppm".

upper_mass_limit.description: Upper limit of the mass range to search for.

window.description: Size of mass window.  Is in units of `type`.

da_window.description: Mass window in units of daltons.  If not null, this will be used for similarity calculations, regardless of whether ppm_window is supplied.

dtxsids.description: List of DTXSIDs to search for.

ms_level.description: Level of mass spectrometry; if supplied, then only spectra at the specified level will be returned.  Valid values are from 1 to 5.

ppm_window.description: Mass window in units of parts per million.  Will only be used if da_window is null or not passed and ppm_window is not null.

spectra.description: A list of spectra, where each spectrum is an array of m/z-intensity pairs formatted as two-element arrays.

spectrum.description: Array of m/z intensity pairs.  Should be formatted as an array of two-element arrays, each of which has the m/z value and the intensity value (in that order).  Peaks should be sorted in increasing order of m/z values.

dtxsid.description: DTXSID for the substance of interest.

get.description:
Takes a string that is interpreted as either an InChIKey, CASRN, DTXSID, or substance name and returns a list of any
substances that match the search term. If no DTXSID is found, the function returns None. If multiple synonyms or
the first block InChIKey matches are found, the response will have an 'ambiguity' variable will be passed indicating
the issue.

If an InChIKey is searched for, the results will consist of all InChIKeys that match the first block of the InChIKey.

parameters.description: A substance identifier.  If it cannot be parsed as an InChIKey, CASRN, or DTXSID, it is assumed to be a name.
parameters.name: search_term

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of substances and a variable that indicates whether there is any ambiguity in the search term.

get.summary: Returns substance(s) that match a search term.

parameters.description: First block of an InChIKey.
parameters.name: first_block

get.summary: Returns a list of substances found by InChIKey.

get.summary: Returns a list of all unique fact sheet types, coming from the document_type field of the fact sheet table.

get.summary: Returns a list of all functional use classes that are assigned to at least one substance.

200.description: List of source names.

get.summary: Returns a list of all unique source names in the database for a specific record type.

post.description:
This endpoint will not return mass spectra stored as PDFs or ones that are only externally linked.

IMPORTANT -- Some substances can potentially have a multiple hundreds of spectra associated with them. Submitting large numbers of substances in an individual transaction is not advised due to potential lag.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of mass spectra and a mapping of DTXSIDs to names for any substances found.

post.summary: Given a list of DTXSIDs, return all mass spectra for those substances.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of database spectra and a deduplicated list of substances that those spectra correspond to.

post.summary: Takes a mass range, methodology, and mass spectrum, and returns all spectra that match the mass and methodology, with entropy similarities between the database spectra and the user-supplied one.

post.description: This endpoint is intended for use with INTERPRET NTA.

200.description: A JSON object with DTXSIDs as keys and an array of highest found entropy similarity scores as the values.  The order of values in the array corresponds to their order in the list of user-submitted spectra.  If no spectra were found for a given DTXSID, the DTXSID will map to None.

post.summary: Given a list of DTXSIDs and a list of mass spectra, return a highest similarity score for each combination of DTXSID and spectrum.

post.description:
Spectra from a variety of methodologies are present in the database; however, all but a few edge cases will be one of GC/MS, LC/MS, NMR, or IR. The returned counts will also include spectra stored as PDFs, not just those stored directly in the database.

This endpoint is currently handled by a POST rather than a GET operation due to the fact that a lot of methodologies have forward slashes in them (e.g., 'LC/MS'), which disrupts routing.

Currently intended for use with applications outside the Vue app.

200.description: A count of spectra in the database for the given substance and analytical methodology.

post.summary: Returns the number of spectra that have a specified methodology.

get.description: This endpoint hits an endpoint on another API for retrieving similarity information. This endpoint is primarily called by the get_similar_structures() endpoint, and has its similarity threshold hardcoded at 0.8.
